answers.answer: I thought if u had with one u have with others but I'd ask dr for sure make sure

I'm on number 4 & this is my only pregnancy I haven't had it with my Dr. Put me on st.Joseph's baby aspirin 81 mg ask your Dr. About mine says it drasticly reduces changes of a repeat wish my last Dr. Would have known I delivered all my babies early & was in horrible pain

I had pre-eclamsia with my now 11 year old son. I am due September 16 so that makes me a little over 30 weeks pregnant right now. So far, I have had excellent blood pressure. However, my now husband and father of my unborn baby is not the biological father of Mt 11 year old. My doctor told me that studies show that the 'trait" for pre-eclamsia actually comes from the father. He predicted early on that I would have no complications with this one since it's a different father and he was sure right.

If you have it once you are more likely to have it again. My sister had ecclampsia with her first and 2nd, her last two she started showing symptoms,  but she has scheduled c-sections with them so we can't say for sure if it would have developed. I've researched it alot and never heard it being anything about the father. In fact if your mother or sister had it, you are more likely to have it. My sisters oldest two have a different dad than her youngest two, and she has either had it or shown signs of it with all 4 childred. Good luck, I hope you don't have a repeat!

I had it with my first two. I'm now pregnant with my third. Doctor says its likely to happen again but I'm taking steps reduce the risk such as reducing salt intake, swimming, reduce stress, and good rest. Good luck hun. Let's hope we don't repeat this time. It is no fun at all.

I had it with my first. Doctor at the time said I will get it with every pregnancy. But it may be not be as serious as the first one or could be serious. A few of my cousins had it too one of them was going great then at 37 weeks her blood pressure went severely high they tested her and showed it was preclampsia and had to have the baby right away. So by the looks of other comment may not get it again or you may get it last few weeks.
I had it with my 1st....absolutely healthy with my second. You're just a little more at risk is all. Try to eliminate salt!

question: What are the odds of having preeclampsia for two pregnancies? Im just wondering, i hope i dont have it again but its really starting to look that way.
title: question
